title: After 5 Years I uninstalled League of Legends
body:
I never thought I would do that because this game is so addicting, but Season 7 was the reason for me to stop this game. It really isn't funny anymore

This are my Top 10 reasons why :

1. Class- Updates
Are to 90% failure. 
After the class updates, this game is even more unbalanced . The game was nearly  balanced in Season 5, then the juggernauts came in.
You ruined my favorite Champion Leblanc, to a clunky annoying to play and play against, delay mage.

2. Champions like Blitz still exist
You can Dodge 99 Hooks, he can stay 0/20  and still win the game when you aren't able to dodge one of his hooks in late game.
How does Designs like this still exist.

3. Champs who can influence other teammates
{{champion:432}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:34}} 
Why is it still possible to cage in other teammates or what ever? i had so many bard ults on me while i was chasing enemies so they could escape.
How is this still a thing I really don't understand

4. Ranked Match making after a win rate. Oh ... what a surprise ? the next 7 games i get matched with : first timers, people who have 2 different divions, people who play a champ they never play meanwhile my enemie team has 4 Level 7 Masterie Mains.  Now I'm back where  I started or even lower. 
And its ALWAYS like that. 

5.  Unsatisfying Report-Function
So basically the enemie calls a wonderful "Gg easy" at the end even though it was a very close match, it doesn't matter if I report him because:
he doesn't get banned anyway or when (what never happens ) I don'T even notice because no one tolds me.
Sometimes I think is the report function even usefull at all ?

6. Why can a only Zeal Yasuo easily outdamage and kill me as a Bf-Sword. Pickaxe, Zeal Jinx using heal.

7. Why can Darius outdamage so much Champions and still be Full Tank like a Shen ?

8. Caitlyn having 5 Traps
This is the most forced update to make a Champ viable I have ever seen. 5 Traps are just way too much

9. Towers are way too weak.  Tower dives in early stages are no problem anymore.

10.  Balancing the game around Lcs more than about the real players.
The only thing this game is alive is the amount of player playing it, not stupid LCS. How long do you need to notice ? 

Well was still fun the other 4 Seasons

i could find many other reasons too .. maybe later

Really...honestly, you're just bad and you're venting. You're getting mad that a juggernaut champ like Darius deals damage. You're mad that Yasuo, *a champion designed to scale much faster than a marksman will,* beat you when you were playing Jinx, *a heavily nerfed late-game marksman,* WHILE YOU DIDN'T EVEN FINISH ONE ITEM YET. You're mad about class reworks for some reason when Riot said they're discontinuing class reworks. You're mad about Caitlyn when she's been nerfed to the point of being the weakest marksman in solo queue, even including Ezreal. You're mad about the LCS, but you're Silver, so Riot wouldn't balance around your skill level, anyway.

Honestly, you should uninstall. This is a case of someone being bad and resorting to baby-raging. Nothing anyone will tell you will convince you to "git gud", so "gitten gone" is the next best thing.

> The game was nearly balanced in Season 5, then the juggernauts came in.

Yeah, if you're really deranged enough to believe that, then I'm glad you uninstalled league. 90% of champs reliant on burst were not viable. Good riddance.

Unfortunately riot's answer to champions having way too much burst was to raise the consistent damage up to the same degree of stupidity that the burst was. 
Which was honestly a bigger mistake than letting burst get out of hand.

I do agree with that, but the cinderhulk meta wasn't some beautiful haven for champions, except maybe tanks. Everyone thinks that all classes were viable, but team comps were 3 tanks 1 utility mage 1 ADC basically, lol. Such a lame fucking meta. And the tanks were the damage dealers.  For some reason no one on the boards seems to remember that but me.

I don't think that's ideal either. Though that could've been addressed by the current design of cinderhulk and sunfire.

It's really simple. Tanks should deal equal cumulative damage (between damage reduction to themselves and damage they have) to other classes, burst champions should require more than a single rotation to kill targets, and flat damage dealers should deal roughly the same DPS as burst champions, but only because those burst champions aren't 1 shotting others.
